Class: Settings

Settings(accountKey, baseUrl, version, contentType)

Class for Account service use in managing API keys

Constructor

new Settings(accountKey, baseUrl, version, contentType)

Instantiate Settings class
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
accountKey string _ Key used to uniquely identify the account. Use _ as parameter value for your current account or account key for sub accounts.
baseUrl string https://api.infobip.com Infobip personal base URL
version number 1 API version. The version is overridable on an individual method call level - useful if some methods are still using old version numbers.
contentType string json The type of data the API returns. Values: "json" or "xml"
Source:
  • service/Settings.js, line 25
Example
// Instantiate Settings class
let settings = new infobip.Settings()

Methods

authorize(auth)

Authorize API calls
Parameters:
Name Type Description
auth Auth Instance of authorization class
Source:
  • service/Settings.js, line 44

(async) getApiKey(key, version) → {Object}

Get an API key by its key
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
key string Key (unique ID) of the API key.
version number 1 The API version to use. If set to "", will use the instance version.
Source:
  • service/Settings.js, line 95
Throws:
Error
Returns:
Type
Object
Example
// Get API key with property key "abc"
console.log(await settings.getApiKey('abc'))

Name Type Default Description

version number 1 The API version to use. If set to "", will use the instance version.

(async) getApiKeys(enabled, version) → {Object}

List all API keys
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
enabled string Filter enabled keys. Values: "true" or "false".
version number 1 The API version to use. If set to "", will use the instance version.

Example

(async) newApiKey(params, version) → {Object}

Create an API key
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
params Object The API key properties
version number 1 The API version to use. If set to "", will use the instance version.
Source:
  • service/Settings.js, line 196
Throws:
Error
Returns:
Type
Object
Example
console.log(await settings.newApiKey({
 "name": "Api key 1",
 "allowedIPs": [],
 "permissions": [
     "ALL"
 ]
}))

(async) updateApiKey(key, params, version) → {Object}

Update an API key
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
key string Key (unique ID) of the API key.
params Object The API key properties to update
version number 1 The API version to use. If set to "", will use the instance version.
Source:
  • service/Settings.js, line 230
Throws:
Error
Returns:
Type
Object
Example
console.log(await settings.updateApiKey('abc', {
 "name": "Api key 2",
 "allowedIPs": ['127.0.0.1']
}))
